ygData.subject: Question Re: HyperNEAT Speciate
ygData.msgSnippet: Jason, Seeming good news/bad news. First, I had made reference to onGeneration equal to 0 in produceNextGeneration and confused it with generations equal to 1

Jason,

   Seeming good news/bad news. First, I had made reference to 
onGe=
neration equal to 0 in produceNextGeneration and confused it with 
generati=
ons equal to 1 in ExperimentRun::start, which is what you 
were refering to=
 with the "generations>0" test. Bad news, I believe 
that for your intended=
 purpose(?), the call to finishEvaluations 
should be inside the "for (size=
_t generations=3D(population-
>getGenerationCount()-1);generations<maxGener=
ations;generations++)" 
braces. 

   I am getting a call to produceNextGene=
ration with generations 
equal to 1, with no prior call to finishEvaluation=
s, with 
species.size equal to 0 and the species ID undefined, resulting in=
 
the exception associated with a call to getSpecies. I note that there 
is=
 some editing in this area. Maybe a difference in compilers (MSVC 
2003)? P=
lease advise.

Thanks,
   Andy Carl


--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Jason G=
auci" <jgmath2000@...> wrote:
>
> ExperimentRun::finishEvaluations should b=
e called before
> GeneticPopulation::produceNextGeneration.  As long as you=
 do that,
> generation 0 will have species.  You shouldn't get the exceptio=
n as
> long as you don't call produceNextGeneration before 
finishEvaluatio=
ns.
>  Notice how there is a "generations>0" if within that for loop.
> 
> =
Sorry for making it backwards like that, but if I put the
> produceNextGene=
ration at the end of the for loop instead of doing it
> the way I did, then=
 it would produce an extra generation at the end
> that would not get used.=

> 
> As a side note, I found out that within the 
GeneticSpecies::makeBabi=
es
> routine, it can get stuck in an infinite loop.  I'm not sure how it
> =
happend, but until I figure it out, I've replaced the while(true)
> loops w=
ith for loops which try 1,000,000 times and then bail by
> choosing the mos=
t fit in the species and doing asexual 
reproduction. 
> It's only happend =
once so it might never happen to you, but just
> thought I'd let you know.
=
> 
> I've made several other improvements too, including a better random
> =
generator.  Once I get beyond this next milestone, I'll release an
> improv=
ed version.
> 
> Thanks a lot for your input, if you still can't get it to =
run, don't
> hesitate to reply and I'll try to help you as best I can.
> 
>=
 
> --- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "afcarl2" <a.carl@> wrote:
> >
> > Jason,
=
> > 
> >    Review of the NEAT portion of the HyperNEAT code indicates 
tha=
t 
> > speciate (and size thereof via pushback), is only called from 
> > a=
djustFitness, which is called from 
ExperimentRun::finishEvaluations. 
> > =
The seeming signifcance of this is that the size of species is 
zero for 
>=
 > generation 0, which in itself is not a problem, but there results 
an 
>=
 > exception in
> > GeneticPopulation::produceNextGeneration, associated wi=
th a call 
to 
> > getSpecies. Since the species ID is undefined for genera=
tion 0 
(since 
> > speciate has not yet been called), the test "if(species=
[a]-
> > >getID()=3D=3Did)" will not be true. Was this intended? Please adv=
ise.
> > 
> > Thanks,
> >    Andy Carl
> >
>
